name: microsoft-graph
label: Microsoft Graph API
description: Microsoft Graph API is a powerful and unified programming interface provided by Microsoft that allows developers to access a wide range of data and services from Microsoft 365 and Azure Active Directory (Azure AD). It provides a single endpoint and a consistent set of RESTful web APIs, making it easier for developers to integrate and interact with Microsoft's cloud services and applications.

fields.title: Get Access Token
options: On behalf of User - Delegate Permission
fields.name: auth_type
fields.description: Select the method using which you will get authentication tokens used to access the security graph APIs. You can choose between On behalf of User - Delegate Permission, Without a User - Application Permission or Certificate Based Authentication.
fields.tooltip: Select the method using which you will get authentication tokens used to access the security graph APIs.

Without a User - Application Permission.title: Server URL
Without a User - Application Permission.name: resource
Without a User - Application Permission.description: Specify the service-based URI to connect and perform automated operations.

Without a User - Application Permission.title: Tenant ID
Without a User - Application Permission.description: Specify the ID of the tenant assigned to you by the Azure application registration portal.
Without a User - Application Permission.tooltip: Specify the ID of the tenant assigned to you by the Azure application registration portal.
Without a User - Application Permission.name: tenant

Without a User - Application Permission.title: Client ID
Without a User - Application Permission.description: Specify the Unique Application ID of the Azure Active Directory application to create an authentication token required to access the API. For information on getting authentication tokens, see the Getting Authentication Tokens section.
Without a User - Application Permission.name: client_id
Without a User - Application Permission.tooltip: Specify the Unique Application ID of the Azure Active Directory application to create an authentication token required to access the API. For information on getting authentication tokens, see the Getting Authentication Tokens section.

Without a User - Application Permission.title: Client Secret
Without a User - Application Permission.description: Specify the Unique Client Secret of the Azure Active Directory application that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API. For information on how to get the secret key, see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/security/threat-protection/microsoft-defender-atp/exposed-apis-create-app-webapp.
Without a User - Application Permission.name: client_secret
Without a User - Application Permission.tooltip: Specify the Unique Client Secret of the Azure Active Directory application that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API.

On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.title: Server URL
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.name: resource
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.description: Specify the service-based URI to connect and perform automated operations.

On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.title: Tenant ID
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.description: Specify the ID of the tenant assigned to you by the Azure application registration portal.
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.tooltip: Specify the ID of the tenant assigned to you by the Azure application registration portal.
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.name: tenant

On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.title: Client ID
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.description: Specify the Unique Application ID of the Azure Active Directory application to create an authentication token required to access the API. For information on getting authentication tokens, see the Getting Authentication Tokens section.
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.name: client_id
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.tooltip: Specify the Unique Application ID of the Azure Active Directory application to create an authentication token required to access the API. For information on getting authentication tokens, see the Getting Authentication Tokens section.

On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.title: Client Secret
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.description: Specify the Unique Client Secret of the Azure Active Directory application that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API. For information on how to get the secret key, see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/security/threat-protection/microsoft-defender-atp/exposed-apis-create-app-webapp.
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.name: client_secret
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.tooltip: Specify the Unique Client Secret of the Azure Active Directory application that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API.

On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.title: Authorization Code
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.name: code
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.tooltip: Specify the authorization code that you acquired during the authorization step
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.description: Specify the authorization code that you acquired during the authorization step. For more information, see the Getting Access Tokens using the Delegate Permissions method section.

On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.title: Redirect URL
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.tooltip: The redirect_uri of your app, where authentication responses can be sent and received by your app. It must exactly match one of the redirect_uri's you registered in the app registration portal.
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.name: redirect_url
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.description: The redirect_uri of your app, where authentication responses can be sent and received by your app. The redirect URL that you specify here must exactly match one of the redirect_uri's you have registered in your app registration portal.

Certificate Based Authentication.title: Server URL
Certificate Based Authentication.name: resource
Certificate Based Authentication.description: Specify the service-based URI to connect and perform automated operations.

Certificate Based Authentication.title: Tenant ID
Certificate Based Authentication.description: Specify the ID of the tenant assigned to you by the Azure application registration portal.
Certificate Based Authentication.tooltip: Specify the ID of the tenant assigned to you by the Azure application registration portal.
Certificate Based Authentication.name: tenant

Certificate Based Authentication.title: Client ID
Certificate Based Authentication.description: Specify the Unique Application ID of the Azure Active Directory application to create an authentication token required to access the API. For information on getting authentication tokens, see the Getting Authentication Tokens section.
Certificate Based Authentication.name: client_id
Certificate Based Authentication.tooltip: Specify the Unique Application ID of the Azure Active Directory application to create an authentication token required to access the API. For information on getting authentication tokens, see the Getting Authentication Tokens section.

Certificate Based Authentication.title: Certificate Thumbprint
Certificate Based Authentication.name: thumbprint
Certificate Based Authentication.description: Provides a thumbprint, fingerprint, or hash, which is a unique identifier generated from a digital certificate using a cryptographic hash function.
Certificate Based Authentication.tooltip: Provides a thumbprint, fingerprint, or hash, which is a unique identifier generated from a digital certificate using a cryptographic hash function.

Certificate Based Authentication.title: Certificate File
Certificate Based Authentication.name: private_key
Certificate Based Authentication.tooltip: Upload a certificate (private key) with one of the following file types: .cer, .pem, .crt
Certificate Based Authentication.description: Upload a certificate (private key) with one of the following file types: .cer, .pem, .crt

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified. By default, this option is set to True.
fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.tooltip: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified.

operations.title: Get Risky Users List
operations.description: Retrieves a list of all risky users from Microsoft Graph API.

operations.title: Get Risky User Details
operations.description: Retrieve details for a specific risky user from Microsoft Graph API based on the user ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Risky User ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the risky user whose details you want to retrieve from Microsoft Graph API.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the risky user whose details you want to retrieve from Microsoft Graph API.
parameters.name: risk_id

operations.title: Get All Security Alerts
operations.description: Retrieves a list of alerts from Microsoft Graph API based on the input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: API Version
parameters.name: api_version
parameters.description: Select the version of the API. If the user selects V2, it provides comprehensive information and detailed context about alerts, where as V1 refers to the older version of the alerts API. By default, V1 is selected.
parameters.tooltip: Select the version of the API. If the user selects V2, it provides comprehensive information and detailed context about alerts, where as V1 refers to the older version of the alerts API. By default, V1 is selected.

V1.title: Vendor
V1.description: Specify the name of the product vendor that provided the alert you want to retrieve using Microsoft Graph API. For example, Microsoft
V1.name: vendor
V1.tooltip: Specify the name of the vendor for the product that provided the alert you want to retrieve using Microsoft Graph API.

V1.title: Provider
V1.description: Specify the security product that provided the alert you want to retrieve using Microsoft Graph API. For example, Cloud Application Security
V1.name: provider
V1.tooltip: Specify the security product that provided the alert you want to retrieve using Microsoft Graph API. For example, Cloud Application Security.

V1.title: Severity
V1.description: Select the alert severity, set by the vendor or provider, to retrieve alerts using Microsoft Graph API. You can choose from the following options: Unknown Low Medium High Informational
V1.tooltip: Select the alert severity, which is set by the vendor or provider based on which you want to retrieve alerts using Microsoft Graph API
V1.name: severity

V1.title: Search From
V1.description: Select the date and time of alert triggering event(s) to retrieve using Microsoft Graph API.
V1.tooltip: Select the DateTime at which the event(s) that served as the trigger(s) to generate the alert you want to retrieve using Microsoft Graph API.
V1.name: search_from

V2.title: Classification
V2.name: classification
V2.description: Select the classification to filter alerts based on the selected classification. Possible values are: Unknown, False Positive, True Positive, Informational Expected Activity, Unknown Future Value
V2.tooltip: Select the classification to filter alerts based on the selected classification. Possible values are: Unknown, False Positive, True Positive, Informational Expected Activity, Unknown Future Value

V2.title: Determination
V2.name: determination
V2.description: Select the determination to filter alerts based on the Selected determination. Possible values are: Unknown, ATP, Malware, Security Personnel, Security Testing, Unwanted Software, Other, MultiStaged Attack, Compromised User, Phishing, Malicious User Activity, Clean, Insufficient Data, Confirmed User Activity, lLne Of Business Application, Unknown Future Value
V2.tooltip: Select the determination to filter alerts based on the Selected determination. Possible values are: Unknown, ATP, Malware, Security Personnel, Security Testing, Unwanted Software, Other, MultiStaged Attack, Compromised User, Phishing, Malicious User Activity, Clean, Insufficient Data, Confirmed User Activity, lLne Of Business Application, Unknown Future Value

V2.title: Status
V2.description: (Optional) Select the status to filter alerts based on the Selected status. You can choose from the following options: Unknown, New Alert, In Progress, or Resolved.
V2.tooltip: Select the status to filter alerts based on the Selected status.
V2.name: status

V2.title: Created Date
V2.name: createdDateTime
V2.description: (Optional) Specify the creation date to filter alerts created after the specified date.
V2.tooltip: Specify the creation date to filter alerts created after the specified date.

V2.title: Last Update Date
V2.name: lastUpdateDateTime
V2.description: (Optional) Specify the modified date to filter alerts modified after the specified.
V2.tooltip: Specify the modified date to filter alerts modified after the specified.

V2.title: Severity
V2.name: severity
V2.description: (Optional) Specify the severity of the alert to filter alerts based on the specified severity.
V2.tooltip: Specify the severity of the alert to filter alerts based on the specified severity.

V2.title: Service Source
V2.name: serviceSource
V2.description: (Optional) Specify the service source of the alert to filter alerts based on the specified service source.
V2.tooltip: Specify the service source of the alert to filter alerts based on the specified service source.

parameters.title: Assigned To
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the name of the analyst to filter alerts assigned to that specific analyst.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the analyst to filter alerts assigned to that specific analyst.
parameters.name: assigned_to

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of records retrieved in the response. The maximum limit is 2000.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of records retrieved in the response. The maximum limit is 2000.
parameters.name: top

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.description: (Optional) Skips the specified number of records in the result set.
parameters.tooltip: Skips the specified number of records in the result set.
parameters.name: skip

operations.title: Get Security Alert
operations.description: Retrieves details of a specific alert from Microsoft Graph API based on the alert ID you have specified.

parameters.title: API Version
parameters.name: api_version
parameters.description: Select the version of the API. If the user selects V2, it provides comprehensive information and detailed context about alerts, where as V1 refers to the older version of the alerts API. By default, V1 is selected.
parameters.tooltip: Select the version of the API. If the user selects V2, it provides comprehensive information and detailed context about alerts, where as V1 refers to the older version of the alerts API. By default, V1 is selected.

parameters.title: Alert ID
parameters.description: Specify the unique Alert ID to retrieve that alert from Microsoft Graph API. The alert ID is generated by the provider when an alert is created in Azure.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the unique Alert ID using which you want to retrieve the specific alert from Microsoft Graph API. The alert ID is generated by the provider when an alert is created in Azure.
parameters.name: alert_id

operations.title: Update Security Alert
operations.description: Updates a specific alert using Microsoft Graph API based on the input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Alert ID
parameters.description: Specify the unique alert ID to update that alert through Microsoft Graph API. The alert ID is generated by the provider when an alert is created in Azure.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the unique Alert ID using which you want to update the specific alert from Microsoft Graph API.
parameters.name: alert_id

parameters.title: API Version
parameters.name: api_version
parameters.description: Select the version of the API. If the user selects V2, it provides comprehensive information and detailed context about alerts, where as V1 refers to the older version of the alerts API. By default, V1 is selected.
parameters.tooltip: Select the version of the API. If the user selects V2, it provides comprehensive information and detailed context about alerts, where as V1 refers to the older version of the alerts API. By default, V1 is selected.

V1.title: Provider
V1.description: Specify the provider of product or service in Azure to update in the specific alert in Azure. For example, WindowsDefenderATP.
V1.tooltip: Specify the provider of product or service in Azure that you want to update in the specific alert in Azure. For example, WindowsDefenderATP.
V1.name: provider

V1.title: Vendor
V1.description: Specify the name of the vendor to update in the specific alert in Azure. For example, Microsoft.
V1.tooltip: Specify the name of the vendor of the alert that you want to update in the specific alert in Azure. For example, Microsoft.
V1.name: vendor

V1.title: Feedback
V1.description: (Optional) Select the analyst feedback on the alert that you want to update in the specific alert in Azure. You can choose from the following options: Unknown, True Positive, False Positive, or Benign Positive.
V1.tooltip: Select the analyst feedback on the alert that you want to update in the specific alert in Azure.
V1.name: feedback

V1.title: Comments
V1.description: (Optional) Select the analyst comments that you want to update in the specific alert in Azure. You can choose between Closed in MCAS or Closed in IPS.
V1.tooltip: Select the analyst comments that you want to update in the specific alert in Azure.
V1.name: comments

V1.title: Tags
V1.description: (Optional) Specify the JSON array of strings that store user-definable labels that can be applied to the alert that you want to update in Azure. These tags serve as filter conditions, and you can specify multiple tags using comma-based separators.
V1.tooltip: Specify the JSON array of strings that store user-definable labels that can be applied to the alert that you want to update in Azure. These tags serve as filter conditions, and you can specify multiple tags using comma-based separators.
V1.name: tags

V1.title: Provider Version
V1.description: (Optional) Specify the version of the provider or sub-provider, if it exists, that generated the alert that you want to update in Azure.
V1.tooltip: Specify the version of the provider or sub-provider, if it exists, that generated the alert that you want to update in Azure.
V1.name: providerVersion

V1.title: Subprovider
V1.description: (Optional) Specify the name of the sub-provider under the aggregating provider in Azure for the alert t that you want to update in Azure. For example, WindowsDefenderATP.SmartScreen
V1.tooltip: Specify the name of the sub-provider under the aggregating provider in Azure for the alert t that you want to update in Azure. For example, WindowsDefenderATP.SmartScreen.
V1.name: subProvider

V1.title: Status
V1.description: (Optional) Select the status (life cycle status) that you want to update in the specific alert in Azure. You can choose from the following options: Unknown, New Alert, In Progress, or Resolved.
V1.tooltip: Select the status (life cycle status) that you want to update in the specific alert in Azure.
V1.name: status

V2.title: Classification
V2.name: classification
V2.description: Specifies the classification of the alert. Possible values are: Unknown, False Positive, True Positive, Informational Expected Activity, Unknown Future Value
V2.tooltip: Specifies the classification of the alert. Possible values are: Unknown, False Positive, True Positive, Informational Expected Activity, Unknown Future Value

V2.title: Determination
V2.name: determination
V2.description: Specifies the determination of the alert. Possible values are: Unknown, ATP, Malware, Security Personnel, Security Testing, Unwanted Software, Other, MultiStaged Attack, Compromised User, Phishing, Malicious User Activity, Clean, Insufficient Data, Confirmed User Activity, lLne Of Business Application, Unknown Future Value
V2.tooltip: Specifies the determination of the alert. Possible values are: Unknown, ATP, Malware, Security Personnel, Security Testing, Unwanted Software, Other, MultiStaged Attack, Compromised User, Phishing, Malicious User Activity, Clean, Insufficient Data, Confirmed User Activity, lLne Of Business Application, Unknown Future Value

V2.title: Status
V2.description: (Optional) Select the status (life cycle status) that you want to update in the specific alert in Azure. You can choose from the following options: Unknown, New Alert, In Progress, or Resolved.
V2.tooltip: Select the status (life cycle status) that you want to update in the specific alert in Azure.
V2.name: status

parameters.title: Assigned To
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the name of the analyst to whom you want to assign the specific alert that you want to update for triage, investigation, or remediation in Azure.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the analyst to whom you want to assign the specific alert that you want to update for triage, investigation, or remediation in Azure.
parameters.name: assigned_to

operations.title: Add Comment on Security Alert
operations.description: Add a comment for an existing alert based on the specified alert ID.

parameters.title: Alert ID
parameters.description: Specify the unique Alert ID to retrieve that alert from Microsoft Graph API. The alert ID is generated by the provider when an alert is created in Azure.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the unique Alert ID using which you want to retrieve the specific alert from Microsoft Graph API. The alert ID is generated by the provider when an alert is created in Azure.
parameters.name: alert_id

parameters.title: Comment
parameters.description: Specify the comment you want for a specific alert based on alert ID using the Microsoft Graph API.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the comment you want for a specific alert based on alert ID using the Microsoft Graph API.
parameters.name: comment

operations.title: Get Groups
operations.description: Retrieves a list of groups from Microsoft Graph API.

operations.title: Get Users Within A Group
operations.description: Retrieves a list of users within a specific group from Microsoft Graph API based on the group ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Group ID
parameters.description: Specify an ID of the group whose users you want to retrieve from Microsoft Graph. Note: To get the Group ID use the Get Groups operation.
parameters.tooltip: Specify an ID of the group whose users you want to retrieve from Microsoft Graph. Note: To get the 'Group ID' use the 'Get Groups' operation.
parameters.name: group_id

operations.title: Search Message in Users Mailbox
operations.description: Searches for messages in a user's mailbox within an organization based on the Subject and user list you have specified.

parameters.title: Subject
parameters.description: Specify a subject based on which you want to search messages in Azure.
parameters.tooltip: Specify a subject based on which you want to search messages in Azure.
parameters.name: subject

parameters.title: User List
parameters.description: Specify a comma-separated list of user IDs based on which you want to search messages in Azure.
parameters.name: user_list
parameters.tooltip: Specify a comma-separated list of user IDs based on which you want to search messages in Azure.

parameters.title: Page Size
parameters.name: size
parameters.tooltip: Number of messages you want to retrieve per user in this request. Default page size is 10. Page size should be between 1 to 1000
parameters.description: (Optional) Number of messages you want to retrieve per user in this request. Default page size is 10. Page size should be between 1 to 1000

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.name: skip
parameters.tooltip: Number of messages you want to skip for each user in this request.
parameters.description: (Optional) Number of messages you want to skip for each in this request.

operations.title: Delete Message
operations.description: Deletes a specific message from the specific user's mailbox in Azure based on the user ID and message ID you have specified.

parameters.title: User ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the user based on which you want to delete the specific message from Azure.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the user based on which you want to delete the specific message from Azure.
parameters.name: user_id

parameters.title: Message ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the message that you want to delete from Azure.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the message that you want to delete from Azure.
parameters.name: message_id

operations.title: Delete Message Bulk
operations.description: Deletes messages from multiple users mailboxes in Azure based on the comma-separated list of users you have specified.

parameters.title: User List
parameters.description: Specify a comma-separated list of users' mailboxes, which is a list of JSON objects, based on which you want to delete bulk messages in Azure. The format of the list is as follows: [ { 'user_id':"", 'message_id':"" }, { 'user_id':"", 'message_id':"" } ]
parameters.name: user_list
parameters.tooltip: Specify a comma-separated list of users mailboxes, which is a list of JSON objects, i.e., [{"user_id":"", "message_id":""}, ...] based on which you want to delete bulk messages in Azure.

operations.title: Revoke User Session
operations.description: Invalidates all the refresh tokens issued to applications for a user.

parameters.title: User ID or PrincipalName
parameters.description: Specify the User ID or PrincipalName of the user whose refresh tokens you want to invalidate (revoke) from Microsoft Graph API.
parameters.name: user
parameters.tooltip: Specify the User ID or PrincipalName of the user whose refresh tokens you want to invalidate (revoke) from Microsoft Graph API.

operations.title: Get All Named Locations
operations.description: Retrieves a list of named location from Azure based on display name, sort order, and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Display Name
parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Specify the display name of the named location to retrieve from Azure.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the display name of the named location to retrieve from Azure.

parameters.title: Required Fields
parameters.name: select
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify filters properties (columns) to retrieve only specified fields in response from Azure. You can choose one or more from ID, Display Name, Created Date Time and Modified Date Time
parameters.tooltip: Specify filters properties (columns) to retrieve only specified fields in response from Azure.

parameters.title: Order By
parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the sort order criterion to sort the results. Select the sorting order in Sort Order field. You can choose from following options: ID, Display Name, Created Date Time or Modified Date Time
parameters.tooltip: Orders results based on specified field.

ID.title: Sort Order
ID.name: order
ID.description: (Optional) Orders the response Ascending or Descending order on specified field. By default it retrieves in ascending order.
ID.tooltip: Orders the response Ascending or Descending order on specified field. By default it retrieves in ascending order

Display Name.title: Sort Order
Display Name.name: order
Display Name.description: (Optional) Orders the response Ascending or Descending order on specified field. By default it retrieves in ascending order.
Display Name.tooltip: Orders the response Ascending or Descending order on specified field. By default it retrieves in ascending order

Created Date Time.title: Sort Order
Created Date Time.name: order
Created Date Time.description: (Optional) Orders the response Ascending or Descending order on specified field. By default it retrieves in ascending order.
Created Date Time.tooltip: Orders the response Ascending or Descending order on specified field. By default it retrieves in ascending order

Modified Date Time.title: Sort Order
Modified Date Time.name: order
Modified Date Time.description: (Optional) Orders the response Ascending or Descending order on specified field. By default it retrieves in ascending order.
Modified Date Time.tooltip: Orders the response Ascending or Descending order on specified field. By default it retrieves in ascending order.

parameters.title: Count
parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Select to retrieve the total count of named locations matched in Azure. By default it is set to false.
parameters.tooltip: Select to retrieve the total count of named locations matched in Azure.

parameters.title: Size
parameters.name: size
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the number of named locations to retrieve in this request.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the number of named locations to retrieve in this request.

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.name: skip
parameters.tooltip: Specify the number of named locations you want to skip in this request.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the number of named locations you want to skip in this request.

operations.title: Block New IP Ranges
operations.description: Blocks IPv4 and IPv6 address ranges in specified NamedLocation in Azure.

parameters.title: IP Named Location's UUID
parameters.name: namedLocationUuid
parameters.description: Specify the unique Named Location ID for which you want block the IP addresses.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the unique Named Location ID for which you want block the IP addresses.

parameters.title: IPv4 Ranges
parameters.name: ipv4_ips
parameters.description: Specify IP address ranges in IPv4 CIDR format (1.2.3.4/32) to be blocked in the specified named location. You can specify multiple IPv4 ranges as comma-separated values. e.g. 10.10.10.10/14, 10.10.10.10/13, 10.10.10.10/09
parameters.tooltip: Specify IP address ranges in IPv4 CIDR format (1.2.3.4/32) to be blocked in the specified named location. You can specify multiple IPv4 ranges as comma-separated values.

parameters.title: IPv6 Ranges
parameters.name: ipv6_ips
parameters.description: Specify IP address ranges in IPv6 format, as defined in IETF RFC5962, to be blocked in the specified named location. You can specify multiple IPv6 ranges as comma-separated values. For example: 2001:db8::/43, 2001:db8::/47
parameters.tooltip: Specify IP address ranges in allowable IPv6 format, defined in IETF RFC5962, to be blocked in the specified named location. You can specify multiple IPv6 ranges as comma-separated values.

operations.title: Unblock IP Ranges
operations.description: Unblocks IPv4 and IPv6 address ranges in specified NamedLocation in Azure.

parameters.title: IP Named Location's UUID
parameters.name: namedLocationUuid
parameters.description: Specify the unique named location ID for which you want unblock the IP addresses.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the unique Named Location ID for which you want unblock the IP addresses.

parameters.title: IPv4 Ranges
parameters.name: ipv4_ips
parameters.description: Specify IP address ranges in IPv4 CIDR format (1.2.3.4/32) to be unblocked in the specified named location. You can specify multiple IPv4 ranges as comma-separated values. For example: 10.10.10.10/14, 10.10.10.10/13, 10.10.10.10/09
parameters.tooltip: Specify IP address ranges in IPv4 CIDR format (1.2.3.4/32) to be unblocked in the specified named location. You can specify multiple IPv4 ranges as comma-separated values.

parameters.title: IPv6 Ranges
parameters.name: ipv6_ips
parameters.description: Specify IP address ranges in IPv6 format, as defined in IETF RFC5962, to be unblocked in the specified named location. You can specify multiple IPv6 ranges as comma-separated values. For example: 2001:db8::/43, 2001:db8::/47
parameters.tooltip: Specify IP address ranges in IPv6 format, as defined in IETF RFC5962, to be unblocked in the specified named location. You can specify multiple IPv6 ranges as comma-separated values.

operations.title: Create IP Named Location
operations.description: Creates a new IP named location in Azure based on specified input parameter.

parameters.title: Display Name
parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Specify the display name of the named location to create in Azure.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the display name of the named location to create in Azure.

parameters.title: Is Trusted
parameters.name: is_trusted
parameters.description: Select if the IP Range is trusted.
parameters.tooltip: Select if the IP Range is trusted.

parameters.title: IPv4 Ranges
parameters.name: ipv4_ips
parameters.description: Specify IP address ranges in IPv4 CIDR format (1.2.3.4/32) to be added in the specified named location. You can specify multiple IPv4 ranges as comma-separated values. For example: 10.10.10.10/14, 10.10.10.10/13, 10.10.10.10/09
parameters.tooltip: Specify IP address ranges in IPv4 CIDR format (1.2.3.4/32) to be added in the specified named location. You can specify multiple IPv4 ranges as comma-separated values. e.g. 10.10.10.10/14, 10.10.10.10/13, 10.10.10.10/09

parameters.title: IPv6 Ranges
parameters.name: ipv6_ips
parameters.description: Specify IP address ranges in IPv6 format, as defined in IETF RFC5962, to be added in the specified named location. You can specify multiple IPv6 ranges as comma-separated values. For example: 2001:db8::/43, 2001:db8::/47
parameters.tooltip: Specify IP address ranges in allowable IPv6 format, defined in IETF RFC5962, to be added in the specified named location. You can specify multiple IPv6 ranges as comma-separated values. e.g. 2001:db8::/43, 2001:db8::/47
